alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 2:01PM CDT until July 11 at 1:40AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Custer and Washita Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Approximately 5 thousand acres of rural lands are covered by depths up to 3 feet... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Depths may be greater at locations where small streams enter the Washita River valley below Clinton. Some farmsteads are flooded and others isolated by water over local roads. Low farm levees may be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to rise to a crest of 20.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CDT.
